id: Chinese Mandarin - Introductory 1-Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington-Wellington High School
name: Chinese Mandarin - Introductory 1
venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington
description:
Chinese Mandarin - Introductory 1 By the end of the course, you'll be able to: • Recognise and pronounce some basic Mandarin sounds • Identify YES/NO questions • Identify CONTENT questions • Introduce yourself briefly • Use some activity verbs • Use what you've learned to create simple conversations Please note the focus of the course is on oral communication, not writing Chinese script.
Note:  Courses need a minimum number to go ahead so if we don't have enough enrolments a few days before the start date, we have to cancel.
We'll let you know by email so please check yours regularly.
If you need to cancel your registration, here are our terms and conditions: "What You Need to Know".

id: French - Introductory 1-Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington-Wellington High School
name: French - Introductory 1
venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington
description:
French - Introductory 1 By the end of the course, you'll be able to: • Greet people and introduce yourself (and others) at a basic level • Use expressions for basic everyday communication • Ask and answer questions about people’s names, nationalities, family, work situation, likes and dislikes (both formal and informal) • Describe and use the rules of pronunciation (including the alphabet) • Understand and use some basic French grammar: the verbs avoir and être, the present tense of a few verbs in -er, articles (definite and indefinite), singular/plural and masculine/feminine of nouns and nationality adjectives, possessive adjectives • Order, offer, accept and refuse food and drink in a café at a basic level • Become more familiar with the cultural aspects related to these topics Note:  Courses need a minimum number to go ahead so if we don't have enough enrolments a few days before the start date, we have to cancel.
We'll let you know by email so please check yours regularly.
If you need to cancel your registration, here are our terms and conditions: "What You Need to Know".

id: Japanese - Introductory 1-Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington-Wellington High School
name: Japanese - Introductory 1
venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington
description:
Japanese - Introductory 1 By the end of the course, you’ll be able to: Introduce yourself and have a simple conversation about family and things around you Numbers up to 10,000 Ask and understand prices Ask and give a daily routine.
Order food at a restaurant.
Explain the position where something is.
NOTE: A condition of enrolment is that you must provide photo ID when you attend.
Note:  Courses need a minimum number to go ahead so if we don't have enough enrolments a few days before the start date, we have to cancel.

id: Spanish - Introductory 1-Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington-Wellington High School
name: Spanish - Introductory 1
venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington
description:
Spanish - Introductory 1 By the end of the course, you'll: • Have developed some ability to express yourself in basic Spanish • Have some ability to use correctly the present, past and "going to" tenses • Have some understanding of how adjectives, my-mine, and the verb tener are used • Have practised the difference between ser/estar and have some ability to use them correctly • Have practised, with some success, the use of numbers and telling the time • Have begun to develop some basic working Spanish vocabulary Note:  Courses need a minimum number to go ahead so if we don't have enough enrolments a few days before the start date, we have to cancel.
We'll let you know by email so please check yours regularly.
If you need to cancel your registration, here are our terms and conditions: "What You Need to Know".

id: Samoan - Introductory 2-Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington-Wellington High School
name: Samoan - Introductory 2
venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington
description:
Samoan - Introductory 2 For those who have done Introductory 1 (16 hours) or have equivalent knowledge e.g. who may have picked up some basic survival language through travel.
By the end of the course, you will: • Build on the language and grammar skills learned in the Introductory 1 course • Have sufficient grammar and vocabulary to conduct a basic conversation in Samoan on everyday topics • Be able to describe and use (at a basic level) correct sentence structure in Samoan • Be able to describe traditional Samoan protocols and use these in practice NOTE: This course is subsidised with funding from the Tertiary Education Commission (TEC) and you must provide photo ID when you attend your first session.
Note:  Courses need a minimum number to go ahead so if we don't have enough enrolments a few days before the start date, we have to cancel.
We'll let you know by email so please check yours regularly.
If you need to cancel your registration, here are our terms and conditions: "What You Need to Know".

id: Creative Writing - A Tasting Plate-Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington-Wellington High School
name: Creative Writing - A Tasting Plate
venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington
description:
Starting is easy so why not give it a go by joining this creative writing ‘tasting plate’.
By the end of the course, you’ll be able to: • Create works of fiction • Develop creative non-fiction text • Explore the natural inner spirit of writing • Discover your unique writer’s voice • Reflect on your own experiences in writing • Investigate different writing strategies • Discover where your personal writing passions sit and what works for you.
Bring pen and paper or a laptop.
It is not a course where you'll be asked to read your work out loud, critique other writers work, or hand in your writing to the tutor.
Note:  Courses need a minimum number to go ahead so if we don't have enough enrolments a few days before the start date, we have to cancel.

id: Poetry Lab-Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington-Wellington High School
name: Poetry Lab
venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington
description:
Poetry Lab This course is ideal for poets of all levels hoping to improve their writing skills, develop their voice and get feedback on their work.
Each class will include a short lecture of things to think about during the session but the rest of the time will be spent workshopping your poems.
Bring pen and paper to all sessions.
What we'll cover: Week 1 - Introduction: experiencing poetry and getting to know your peers Week 2 - Finding Inspiration Week 3 - Avoiding the cliché Week 4 - Bringing out your voice Week 5 - Embracing the page Week 6 - Poetry as performance When the course is complete there will be a live class poetry reading!
If you need to cancel your registration, here are our terms and conditions: "What You Need to Know".

id: Paint Pouring – Beginners-Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington-Wellington High School
name: Paint Pouring – Beginners
venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington
description:
Embark on a colourful adventure in our paint pouring workshop, guided by our passionate tutor, Aimee!
Discover the mesmerising techniques that turn every canvas into a unique masterpiece.
Please note your canvases will still be wet when you leave and you will have foil trays to transport them in – but you do need to have suitable transport (e.g. car) to be able to get two wet A4 canvases safely home.
Note:  Courses need a minimum number to go ahead so if we don't have enough enrolments a few days before the start date, we have to cancel.
If you need to cancel your registration, here are our terms and conditions: "What You Need to Know".

id: Beeswax Candle Making-Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington-Wellington High School
name: Beeswax Candle Making
venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington
description:
Beeswax Candle Making Have you always admired the beauty and fragrance of beeswax candles and wondered how they are made?
Join Jill in this 2-hour workshop where you will learn how to make three different styles of these candles using beeswax sheets.
These are great for gifting as well!
All materials included in course fee, bring a pen and paper to take notes if you wish.
By the end of the course, you’ll be able to: Make three styles of candles Know where to source wax and wick to continue making your own at home Be proud of a home-made product created with your own hands Note:  Courses need a minimum number to go ahead so if we don't have enough enrolments a few days before the start date, we have to cancel.

id: Jewellery Making - Soldered Fidget Rings-Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington-Wellington High School
name: Jewellery Making - Soldered Fidget Rings
venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington
description:
Jewellery Making - Soldered Fidget Rings In this one-day workshop you are offered a hands-on opportunity to create custom rings with fun mobile components and unique textures.
We'll also practice and build experience in the essential jeweller’s fabrication skills of sawing, filing, soldering, sanding and polishing.
What are fidget rings?
Remember to bring your reading glasses if a have them.
Note:  Courses need a minimum number to go ahead so if we don't have enough enrolments a few days before the start date, we have to cancel.

id: Cooking: Vietnamese Street Food-Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington-Wellington High School
name: Cooking: Vietnamese Street Food
venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington
description:
Cooking: Vietnamese Street Food Join our experienced Vietnamese cook and find out how to create a range of traditional dishes from different parts of Vietnam that you can eat for breakfast, lunch and dinner or at any time of day.
Recipes include delicious wraps, pancakes, beef noodle soup, fried rolls with rice noodles and much more.
By the end of the course, you’ll be able to: • Define what characterises Vietnamese cooking and key ingredients • Recognise and make popular street food from North to South of Vietnam • Identify retail outlets which supply Vietnamese ingredients • More confidently follow recipes provided and prepare those recipes with supervision • Prepare dishes for home eating or entertaining All ingredients provided but bring an apron, dish cloth, tea towels and containers to take food home.
Note: Our cooking courses are designed to provide a collaborative and immersive learning experience where learners often work in pairs and/or groups.
While we wish to create an inclusive environment for all participants, it is important to note that our courses are unable to accommodate specific food allergies or deviate from the preplanned dishes and menus.

id: Sculpture - Intro to Creature Sculpting-Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington-Wellington High School
name: Sculpture - Intro to Creature Sculpting
venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington
description:
Sculpture - Intro to Creature Sculpting Join us for a fun day of creature making!
Design and sculpt a one-of-a-kind character in your own style from polymer clays in a full spectrum of colours!
The class offers beginner students a fun introduction to sculpting organic forms from scratch, and for those with some hands-on creative experience, it offers a great opportunity to experiment, hone and advance your making skills to new levels.
Remember to bring your reading glasses if you have them.
If you need to cancel your registration, here are our terms and conditions: "What You Need to Know".

id: Jewellery Making - Faceted Gemstone Settings-Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington-Wellington High School
name: Jewellery Making - Faceted Gemstone Settings
venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington
description:
Jewellery Making - Faceted Gemstone Settings In this challenging and exciting workshop students will learn to set glimmering round-cut faceted gemstones into brass, copper and/or silver.
Students with prior Flush Setting and soldering experience may advance to other methods and to try their hand at learning ‘Bead Setting’, or a simple form of ‘Prong Setting’.
bring a work apron if you have one or wear clothes you don’t mind getting a little grubby.
By the end of the course, students will be able to: Develop jewellery making skills with introductory faceted stone setting methods Create a simple stone set project - either earrings, a pendant, or a ring.
If you need to cancel your registration, here are our terms and conditions: "What You Need to Know".

id: Mosaic Design-Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington-Wellington High School
name: Mosaic Design
venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington
description:
Mosaic Design You'll be able to make several pieces of mosaic to your own design and after the completion of the course, will feel confident to carry on working on your own projects.
A list of materials and tools required (approximate cost $70, depending what you may already have at home) will be sent out when course numbers are confirmed.
Please wear clothing and footwear suitable for a workshop environment.
By the end of the four-week course, you'll be able to: • Demonstrate the basic principles/techniques of mosaic design • Break and cut tiles correctly • Place tiles on the object • Stick pieces to flat and curved surfaces • Grout a mosaic piece • Use stones and shells in mosaics Note:  Courses need a minimum number to go ahead so if we don't have enough enrolments a few days before the start date, we have to cancel.
We'll let you know by email so please check yours regularly.

id: Cooking: Vietnamese Street Food-Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington-Wellington High School
name: Cooking: Vietnamese Street Food
venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington
description:
Cooking: Vietnamese Street Food Join our experienced Vietnamese cook and find out how to create a range of traditional dishes from different parts of Vietnam that you can eat for breakfast, lunch and dinner or at any time of day.
Recipes include delicious wraps, pancakes, beef noodle soup, fried rolls with rice noodles and much more.
By the end of the course, you’ll be able to: • Define what characterises Vietnamese cooking and key ingredients • Recognise and make popular street food from North to South of Vietnam • Identify retail outlets which supply Vietnamese ingredients • More confidently follow recipes provided and prepare those recipes with supervision • Prepare dishes for home eating or entertaining All ingredients provided but bring an apron, dish cloth, tea towels and containers to take food home.
Note: Our cooking courses are designed to provide a collaborative and immersive learning experience where learners often work in pairs and/or groups.

id: Qi Gong-Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington-Wellington High School
name: Qi Gong
venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington
description:
Qi Gong Qigong has both psychological and physical components and involves the regulation of the mind, breath, and body’s movement and posture.
In most forms of qigong: Breath is slow, long, and deep.
Breath patterns may switch from abdominal breathing to breathing combined with speech sounds.
Dynamic (active) qigong techniques primarily focus on body movements, especially movements of the whole body or arms and legs.

name: Beeswax Candle Making
venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington
description:
Beeswax Candle Making Have you always admired the beauty and fragrance of beeswax candles and wondered how they are made?

All materials included in course fee, bring a pen and paper to take notes if you wish.

id: Mindful Awareness Workshop-Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington-Wellington High School
name: Mindful Awareness Workshop
venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington
description:
Mindful Awareness – One-Day Workshop This course is free for NZ citizens and residents.
Please enrol online and bring photo ID when attending the workshop.
If you are not a NZ citizen or resident, a fee of $149 applies and you must phone the office on 04 385 8919 to register.
“If we don’t know what we’re doing, how can we do what we want?” A hands-on, one-day workshop blending mindfulness, neuroscience, and self-awareness to help you feel better, relate better, and live with more clarity and purpose.
What you’ll get: Simple tools to soothe stress and calm your system Strategies to respond wisely instead of reacting on autopilot Insight into your feelings, needs and inner patterns Cutting-edge knowledge of the Vagus nerve and how it shapes your wellbeing An intro to Parts Work: understand the different parts of you and how they work together Practical ways to build creativity, clarity and genuine connection Skills to feel stronger in yourself, your relationships and your work life Everyday tools for better health, resilience and emotional balance Real tools.

id: Mosaic Design-Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington-Wellington High School
name: Mosaic Design

id: Storytelling On Stage-Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington-Wellington High School
name: Storytelling On Stage
venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington
description:
Storytelling On Stage Live storytelling is an artform unto itself, requiring different skills and techniques from standup comedy or prose writing.
In this four-part workshop, you’ll learn: - Creative writing exercises and daily practices to to find meaningful stories from your life - Tools for crafting a compelling personal narrative - Techniques to build suspense, drama, and humour into your stories - Stagecraft and performance skills to heighten and polish your delivery By the end of the class you'll have - One or more polished 5-10 minute stories to showcase on stage - Dozens of ideas to expand upon for future stories - Writing practices to improve your life as a creative - Less stage fright and more confidence as a speaker Note:  Courses need a minimum number to go ahead so if we don't have enough enrolments a few days before the start date, we have to cancel.
We'll let you know by email so please check yours regularly.
If you need to cancel your registration, here are our terms and conditions: "What You Need to Know".

id: The Joy of Improvisation-Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington-Wellington High School
name: The Joy of Improvisation
venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington
description:
The Joy of Improvisation Improv is theatre without a script and a fun way to build your skills in many areas, including team work, public speaking, storytelling and on-your-feet creative thinking.
This is the perfect place for absolute beginners to get acquainted with the joy and art of improvisation, inspired by the generous creative philosophy of Keith Johnstone.
WIT has been teaching this course in association with the CEC for almost 20 years now.
It uses fun games and structured exercises to teach the foundation skills of improv.
Note:  Courses need a minimum number to go ahead so if we don't have enough enrolments a few days before the start date, we have to cancel.

id: Ukulele - Beginners-Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington-Wellington High School
name: Ukulele - Beginners
venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington
description:
Ukulele - Beginners Have fun (earn chocolate!)
and learn to play common chords and strum patterns.
Please note your ukulele must be tuned to standard C tuning.
By the end of the course, you'll be able to: • Play the most useful and common chords: C, F, G7, G and D • Play common strum patterns at a basic level • Make basic chord changes • Play at least eight “campfire” songs at a basic level • Tune your instrument • Play in other keys using more chords Bring your ukulele.
Note:  Courses need a minimum number to go ahead so if we don't have enough enrolments a few days before the start date, we have to cancel.

id: Microsoft Excel - Beginners-Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington-Wellington High School
name: Microsoft Excel - Beginners
venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington
description:
Windows skills essential - this is not a course for absolute beginners to computing.
A condition of enrolment is that you must provide photo ID when you attend.
Note: All computer courses are run in the school computer labs and you are required to use the school desktops for the duration of the course (you are not able to use your own laptop).
By the end of the course, you'll have had a basic introduction to using MS Excel, including how to: • Identify elements of a workbook • Page setup and printing • Enter and edit data and basic formatting • Generate basic calculations • Use cell references and built-in functions Note:  Courses need a minimum number to go ahead so if we don't have enough enrolments a few days before the start date, we have to cancel.
We'll let you know by email so please check yours regularly.

id: Adobe InDesign - Beginners-Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington-Wellington High School
name: Adobe InDesign - Beginners
venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington
description:
You'll be shown the program and the main features of its desktop, and then be taken through how to create and work with the main publishing items (text and graphics) in order to create your own publication.
Note: All computer courses are run in the school computer labs and you are required to use the school desktops for the duration of the course (you are not able to use your own laptop).
Some of the courses may require you to login onto the network.
By the end of the course you'll be able to: • Describe the features of InDesign and how to work with them • Create text frames, connect text frames and format text • Create shapes and frames and format them • Import pictures into publications • Use rulers, guides and the pasteboard to lay out pages • Finish off, check and then print Note:  Courses need a minimum number to go ahead so if we don't have enough enrolments a few days before the start date, we have to cancel.
If you need to cancel your registration, here are our terms and conditions: "What You Need to Know".
